meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm diving into Dave the Diver, a game that's got everyone raving like a fish market on a Saturday morning. As a critic, I'm not afraid to get my fins dirty and share my thoughts with you.

First off, let me say that the Guardian gave it a perfect score, calling it "demanding work" but somehow making it sound sexy. I mean, who doesn't love a good challenge? Impulsegamer agrees, saying it's a "true indie gem." Vgames calls it one of the best games of 2023, and GameCritics praises its attention to detail (I'm looking at you, fish index!). CGMagazine says it's a fundamental title that'll be talked about alongside Stardew Valley. Even SECTOR.sk is impressed, comparing the game's ingredients and recipes to a delicious meal.

Game Rant, however, gives it an 80, saying that it feels shallow on the surface but has depth when you dive in (get it? Dive? Okay, moving on...). Still, they admit that it's got heart, good music, and memorable characters. I mean, who wouldn't want to befriend a fish-talking mermaid?

So, what does Dave the Diver have to offer? Well, for starters, it's got a unique blend of gameplay mechanics, side-missions, cutscenes, and eccentric characters. The story is engaging, and the cooking minigames are surprisingly fun (I won't lie, I spent way too much time whipping up fishy feasts).

The rhythm games, on the other hand, left me feeling like I was swimming against the current â€“ but hey, that's all part of the fun! And let's not forget about the exploration and fishing aspects, which are just as exciting.

In conclusion, Dave the Diver is a game that will hook you in (sorry, had to!) with its engaging story, addictive gameplay, and lovable characters. It's a true indie gem that'll make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside, like a fish cooked to perfection.

Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some virtual diving to do...
